channel.title: Superbowl 2012
channel.description: I think Giants can pull this one off, but don't hate everyone has their opinions

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

It happens more often then you think according to the NFL experts because all they do is talk about football.

I don’t like Tom Brady he doesn’t show class. I’ve seen some quarterbacks and coaches drop the F bomb on live tv. It isn’t right, rarely have I seen quarterbacks like Donovan McNabb, Tim Tebow, Randall Cunningham cuss on live tv. You’re a professional football player and you should be held to a higher standard. I hold professional quarterbacks athletes to a higher standard and those who have and maintain that positive attitude on and off the field.

Read full topic

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:61, topic:431950”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=534657.msg3913054#msg3913054 date=1328928993]
It happens more often then you think according to the NFL experts because all they do is talk about football.
[/quote]

I haven’t heard anything like that. Who are the NFL experts? There is a difference between being angry and disagreeing and openly cussing at each other on the sidelines.[/quote]

Watch the video I posted with my post earlier if you haven’t already.

Read full topic

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:58, topic:431950”]NFL players and coaches yell at each other all the time but it doesn’t usually happen with a star player like Tom Brady.

ESPN.com

Brady, Pats OC separated after fiery exchange

Patriots quarterback Tom Brady and offensive coordinator Bill O'Brien had a heated exchange during Sunday's game.

I don’t think it happens all the time. Good teams have good chemistry and having good chemistry means that you aren’t yelling at your coaches.

Read full topic

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:54, topic:431950”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=534657.msg3912108#msg3912108 date=1328841270]

If you’re not in the NFL, you cannot say a team sucks because those players have made it to the NFL which means they are good. Yes, I am a Patriots fan but all players in the NFL are good, it just depends on who is better. I highly doubt you know how much pressure are on their hands, especially in the Super Bowl. And don’t be disrespecting Tom Brady, I’d like to see you sign a 4 year contract for $79 million and in this case, I believe dis-respectfulness is jealousy.

Were mostly talking about character. Yeah sure bradys good but he’s the biggest arrogant baby in the NFL. If you disagree than youre just as arrogant as he is.

Brady has got a potty mouth. Everytime he throws a pic he cusses and then yells at the offensive coordinator.
[/quote]

I myself being a professional athlete can say that every professional does this. Because when they lose or fuck up they take it to heart and the best way is to rage. Say your in a sport and you mess up are you going to go aw maybe next time? If you are then your probably not competing with the big boys.[/quote]

Unless you are a professional football player, I don’t think you can really tell what goes on behind the scenes. Football is the ultimate team sport, it’s not like baseball. In baseball, you can hit 4 homeruns and still lose a game.

The great quarterbacks are those who make a mistake and get right back into it. The quarterback is the leader of the team and if he gets down he brings the whole team down. I play football at a highschool level and if you start cussing and yelling at the coach it affects you and it affects the team. It’s alright if you cuss to yourself and say, “damn it man.” That’s fine but you go over to your coach and yell at him, that’s not alright.

Read full topic

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @KingoftheCastle KingoftheCastle
item.description:
@KingoftheCastle wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:55, topic:431950”][quote author=KingoftheCastle link=topic=534657.msg3912105#msg3912105 date=1328841208]

[/quote]

That makes absolutely no sense. One, because not everyone has the same personality. Two, just because a lot of people favor him and disagree with your comment, doesn’t mean they’re arrogant…[/quote]
You make no sense
1 what does personality have to do with anything. Bradys an arrogant crybaby, FACT.
2 yes it does

Read full topic

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

3lv3n snip3r:

If you’re not in the NFL, you cannot say a team sucks because those players have made it to the NFL which means they are good. Yes, I am a Patriots fan but all players in the NFL are good, it just depends on who is better. I highly doubt you know how much pressure are on their hands, especially in the Super Bowl. And don’t be disrespecting Tom Brady, I’d like to see you sign a 4 year contract for $79 million and in this case, I believe dis-respectfulness is jealousy.

True, have you seen sports science? They did something with Jason Pierre-Paul and you realize the caliber these guys play at. If you have a defensive end that is that big, you need to have someone better playing as an offensive tackle, which in the Eagle’s case was Jason Peters who man handled JPP.

[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MhIGYUi3l8U[/youtube]

Read full topic

item.title: Superbowl 2012
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:43, topic:431950”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=534657.msg3910330#msg3910330 date=1328657945]

It should have been niners and ravens in the superbowl. THAT would be a good game. Niners kick returner fumbled and lsot the game with like 3 minutes left. And Baltimore rushed thier kicker, they should have used a timeout. ehh, theres always next year

I agree, but what most will say, it’s part of the game. The ravens & patriots game was the worst Tom Brady has ever played in the playoffs.
[/quote]

what the about the LAST time the ravens played the pats in the playoffs? Suggs destroyed him[/quote]

Like I said, it’s part of the game. The Superbowl this year wasn’t between the two greatest teams. This is what makes me mad but there will always be next year.

Read full topic
